alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 8:24PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Areas along the Verde River from near Paulden to Clarkdale. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Rises in small streams and creeks. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 822 PM MST, Stream gauges continue to show minor rises on the Verde River near Paulden and Perkinsville. Rapid river rises will be possible in the advisory area, potentially leading to minor flooding. Between 1.25 and 2.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Verde River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Perkinsville, Cottonwood and Tuzigoot National Monument. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
